7.m: But he was pierced for our transgressions; he was crushed for our iniquities; upon him was the chastisement that brought us peace, and with his wounds we are healed. - Isaiah 53:5 (ESV)

l.q: Who was prophesied about in Isaiah 53?
In verse 3, how would Jesus Christ be received by the people?
l.a: Jesus Christ would be despised and rejected and would not be esteemed.

l.q: In verse 6, what is man's spiritual condition?
l.a: We have all gone astray and turned our own way.

l.q: In verse 11, what would be the purpose of Christ's coming here on earth?
l.a: Jesus Christ will bear our iniquities and will satisfy God's wrath and many will be made right with God.

7.a: Enjoy a cup of warm chocolate or apple cider with someone who lives with you.
